CA1816.fullDescription: A method that is an implementation of Dispose does not call GC.SuppressFinalize; or a method that is not an implementation of Dispose calls GC.SuppressFinalize; or a method calls GC.SuppressFinalize and passes something other than this (Me in Visual Basic).

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.

CS8622.shortDescription: Nullability of reference types in type of parameter doesn't match the target delegate (possibly because of nullability attributes).

CS8625.shortDescription: Cannot convert null literal to non-nullable reference type.

CS8765.shortDescription: Nullability of type of parameter doesn't match overridden member (possibly because of nullability attributes).

S107.shortDescription: Methods should not have too many parameters
S107.fullDescription: Methods with a long parameter list are difficult to use because maintainers must figure out the role of each parameter and keep track of their position.

S2436.shortDescription: Types and methods should not have too many generic parameters
S2436.fullDescription: A method or class with too many type parameters has likely aggregated too many responsibilities and should be split.

S2696.shortDescription: Instance members should not write to "static" fields
S2696.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue each time a static field is updated from a non-static method or property.

S2953.fullDescription: IDisposable is an interface implemented by all types which need to provide a mechanism for releasing unmanaged resources.

S3010.shortDescription: Static fields should not be updated in constructors
S3010.fullDescription: Assigning a value to a static field in a constructor could cause unreliable behavior at runtime since it will change the value for all instances of the class.

S3168.fullDescription: An async method with a void return type does not follow the task asynchronous programming (TAP) model since the return type should be Task or Task<TResult>

S3260.shortDescription: Non-derived "private" classes and records should be "sealed"
S3260.fullDescription: Classes and records with either private or file access modifiers arent visible outside of their assemblies or files, so if theyre not extended inside their scope, they should be made explicitly non-extensible with the addition of the sealed keyword.

S3776.shortDescription: Cognitive Complexity of methods should not be too high
S3776.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when the code cognitive complexity of a function is above a certain threshold.

S3881.fullDescription: The IDisposable interface is a mechanism to release unmanaged resources, if not implemented correctly this could result in resource leaks or more severe bugs.

S3887.shortDescription: Mutable, non-private fields should not be "readonly"
S3887.fullDescription: Using the readonly keyword on a field means it cant be changed after initialization. However, thats only partly true when applied to collections or arrays. The readonly keyword enforces that another instance cant be assigned to the field, but it cannot keep the contents from being updated. In practice, the field value can be changed, and the use of readonly on such a field is misleading, and youre likely not getting the behavior you expect.
